title: Q Awards 2019: Lewis Capaldi, Foals, Kano lead red carpet
text:
The Q Awards are the place to be tonight (Picture: Rex)

Lewis Capaldi led the Q Awards 2019 red carpet today with the likes of Foals, Kano, Rose McGowan and Christine and the Queens hot on his trail.

A who’s who of the music industry flocked to Camden’s iconic Roundhouse on Wednesday afternoon, to celebrate another great year of music.

Lewis, who is up for three awards, kept it cool and casual in a black denim jacket teamed with black trousers and a white tee. Ever his typical cheery self, the Scottish singer flashed two thumbs up while posing for photos – maybe he’s feeling lucky about his chances?

Representing the groups were Biffy Clyro, who performed a gig in celebration of the Q Awards last night, while Foals got into formation and graced the red carpet.

Other stars who arrived in time for the ceremony, include Kano, Christine and the Queens and Hollywood actress Rose McGowan.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Jarvis Cocker caused quite a stir on the red carpet, holding up a banner that read: ‘No music on a dead planet,’ while posing alongside climate change activists Extinction Rebellion.

Singer Nadine Shah is set to host the prestigious music event, becoming the first woman to do in Q Awards history.

Biffy Clyro performed a special gig last night (Picture: Rex Features)

Lewis Capaldi is feeling lucky (Picture: Rex Features)

Kano looked dapper in his navy suit (Picture: PA)

Jimmy Eat World were in strong formation (Photo by John Phillips/Getty Images)

Dizzee Rascal scrubs up well (Picture: Rex Features)

Rose McGowan looked her red carpet best (Picture: Rex Features)

A total of 18 awards will be given out tonight, including new categories Q song of the decade and Q best vocal performance.

Competition is tight this year with the likes of Stormzy, Billie Eilish, The 1975, Slowthai and Lewis Capaldi among those leading the nominations.

Stormzy’s Vossi Bop is up against People from The 1975, Bad Guy from Billie Eilish, Lewis Capaldi’s Someone You Loved and Lizzo’s banger Juice, in the Q best track category.

Game of Thrones star Isaac Hempstead Wright (Picture: Getty Images)

Dave Berry made a low-key appearance (Picture: Rex Features)

The 1975 skipped the red carpet but found their way to their table (Picture: Getty Images)

Anne-Marie rocked all black everything (Picture: Rex Features)

Little Sims went for a matching number (Picture: PA)

Richard Hawley looking all kinds of cool (Picture: Rex Features)

Michael Kiwanuka wrapped up warm (Picture: PA)

Jarvis Cocker was joined by Extinction Rebellion protestors (Picture: Rex Features)

Nominated for Q best album are When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go? from Billie Eilish, A Brief Inquiry Into Online Relationships from The 1975, Nothing Great About Britain from Slowthai, Everything Not Save Will Be Lost (Part 1) from Foals, and Dave’s Psychodrama, which recently won the Mercury Prize award.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And the rivalry is just as fierce in the Q best solo act category with Lewis Capaldi, Stormzy, Dave, Billie Eilish, Liam Gallagher, Florence Welch and Kano among the artists up with a nod.

So basically, it’s set to be one heck of a show.

Last night, Biffy Clyro ushered in the Q Awards with a special performance at the Roundhouse, where they recorded MTV Unplugged in 2017.
